alert.note: Alert for Christian (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 8:43PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Greene and Webster. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 840 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain from thunderstorms has ended across the area, but runoff from the earlier heavy rain will continue late this evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Pedelo Creek at Highway U, Parchcorn Creek at Smyrna Road, Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Finley River at Highway Z, Finley River at Johns Ford Road and Bull Creek at Center Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Springfield, Ozark, Strafford, Highlandville, Rogersville, Seymour, Sparta, Fordland, Diggins, Spokane, Bruner, Linden, Turners, Oldfield, Northview, Christian Center and Selmore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
